column4: doing fresh install of jaunty and after installing nvidia driver from the hardware driver manager X won't start until I revert to old config. I know nvidia drivers suck but it used to work flawlessly in previous versions what is the problem?
nvidia drivers are among the better ones.. how do you mean "won't start".. how do you "revert to old config" ?
I get the X reconfigure screen asking if I want to revert or start x in low graphics mode
sure give me a couple minutes
what does you xorg.conf look like?
you want to use the open source nvidia driver? or the binary driver?
then remove the "driver nv" line in xorg.conf
I changed that manually so X would start it used to say "nvidia" which didn't work
hmm... if I were you I would uninstall everything nvidia using synaptic.. including nvidia glx and so on..reboot and try reinstalling the binary driver
already did a apt-get --purge remove nvidia* and started over. didn't work
odd.. does the live cd work for you?
yes but I think I found some instructions that might work. don't know why jaunty doesn't work. hopefully they get it fixed for Karmic. I'll give these instructions a shot. Thanks

I thought I would share my solution. I finally found it.  I have a hauppauge tv card that uses the cx18 driver that conflicts with the nvidia binary so I had to add vmalloc=256 to my kernel line in the menu.lst and everything worked great. thought I'd share in case others have the same issue
